name: Death Knight
lore: A death knight is a once-noble warrior—typically a paladin—who broke their sacred oaths and was cursed with undeath. Retaining formidable martial prowess and dark spellcasting, a death knight exists in a state of torment and fury, commanding legions of lesser undead as it wages endless campaigns of destruction. Only atonement or a Wish spell can end the cycle of a death knight's restoration.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The death knight has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Marshal Undead
traits.description: Unless the death knight has the Incapacitated condition, it and each Undead of its choice within 60 feet of it have Advantage on saving throws against features that turn Undead.

traits.name: Undead Restoration
traits.description: If the death knight is destroyed, it regains all its Hit Points in 1d10 days and becomes active again. The death knight appears at a random location on the same plane of existence where it was destroyed. Only a Wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

multiattack.description: The death knight makes three Unholy Longsword attacks. It can replace one of those attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Unholy Longsword
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) Slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage.

actions.name: Hellfire Orb
actions.description: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of itself. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) Fire damage plus 35 (10d6) Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The death knight casts one of its available spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks).

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To use this Reaction, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
reactions.trigger: The death knight is hit by a melee attack roll.

actions.name: Abyssal Word
actions.description: The death knight uses Spellcasting to cast Command.

actions.name: Advance
actions.description: The death knight moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

actions.name: Frightful Strike
actions.description: The death knight makes one Unholy Longsword attack. On a hit, the target must also succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition until the end of the target's next turn.

conditions.duration: until the end of the target's next turn
